#COVID19 3/n: Those of you thinking at the $$ signs that @NIH & other organizations might be throwing at you; don‚Äôt forget the sacrifices of those on your IACUCs, IRBs and IBCs. We work our butts off-LISTEN when we provide advice back, this is not just paperwork!

#COVID19 2/n Everyone suddenly wants patient samples, everyone thinks they can just pivot and submit a protocol. NO, you can‚Äôt just submit a protocol and expect it to be approved. We have a duty to promote a safe and efficient research environment - those are not binary choices.

#COVID19 1/n Many of us on the trench lines working to provide reagents that will save lives don‚Äôt have the time to write grants right now: everyone suddenly wants a piece of the pie! Where was the support for the infrastructure & IBC when we needed it? https://t.co/6uq6vHtbE3

#COVID19 #SocialDistancing Guiding principles: (5) twice daily temp logs entered on google docs‚Äî already set up 10 days ago; everyone now has baseline; no temp check, no work!  (6) try to maintain same guiding principles at home, (7) always err on side of safety

#COVID19 #SocialDistancing Guiding principles: (4) if you have to talk in person, stand at least 1.5 meters away, better yet, wear a mask (unabated community spread in NYC means assuming anyone can be contagious but not yet overtly symptomatic.)

#COVID19 #SocialDistancing Guiding principles provided to key personel in lab: (1) Maintain strict hand hygiene. (2) Maintain personal QT workspace (desk, computer, mouse, pens etc.) (3) Assume any new surface as contaminated if you have not physically de-con it yourself...
